item.title: One year ago we were at the Aurora City Council demanding...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

One year ago we were at the Aurora City Council demanding accountability for the APD officers who killed Elijah McClain. The council attempted to stifle public comment and force us out of the meeting room to come in one at a time. 70 people refused to leave their seats and forced the council to continue hearing the community.

Today it has been more than 14 months since Elijah was murdered, and we still have not seen justice. His killers still walk free, but several activists ...are now facing severe criminal charges for peaceful protests, including three members of the PSL who are facing the potential of decades in prison. The city of Aurora and the Aurora Police Department remain steadfast in their determination to silence protest rather than deliver justice for Elijah McClain and this community. But like a year ago, we will continue to refuse to be silenced.

#JusticeforElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO

See MoreParty for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Last night, a large group of protesters shut down the Aurora city council meeting over the police murder of Elijah McClain and the total lack of consequences th...at have resulted from it.

This article, like the council itself, privileges civility and order over the substance of why people are outraged.

Elijah was killed more than two months ago. His killers are still on the police force, still collecting checks from the city, when they should be in jail awaiting trial.

Outraged community members and activists have appealed to the city numerous times to take action. Very often it looks like council members are not even listening.

PSL was among those who shut down last night's city council meeting. The council had taken issue with the crowd clapping in support of speakers, which amplified the message of anger directed at them. They tried to force us all out into the hall, where they would send us in one at a time to speak.

Some 70 people refused to get up from their seats and successfully forced the council to carry on with public comment.

The message to the council was that we're not asking--we're demanding. We are not going away. We are more than them, we are united, and we will not take no for an answer. Justice for Elijah McClain!

See MoreMetroPolice & CourtsY AM edition - LOCAL Protesters shut down Aurora City Council meeting over officer-involved death of Elijah McClain By KARA MASON, Staff Writer - November 5, 2019 441 Facebook Twitter Email Print AURORA | A sometimes profane group of chanting protestors urging justice for Elijah....

sentinelcolorado.com

item.title: After last night’s indecisive result, a massive effort is...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

After last night’s indecisive result, a massive effort is underway by the Trump campaign and Republican Party apparatus to prevent hundreds of thousands if not millions of votes from being counted. This effort has a clear racist character — hundreds of thousands of mail-in ballots concentrated in cities with majority or near-majority Black populations have yet to be tabulated, and the final outcome of the election hangs in the balance.

The winner of the election is in doubt even though there is no dispute over which candidate received more votes. The completely bankrupt nature of “democracy” under capitalism is illuminated for all to see.

After last night’s indecisive result, a massive effort is underway by the Trump campaign and Republican Party apparatus to prevent hundreds of thousands if not millions of votes from being counted. This effort has a clear racist character. #racism #votersuppression

liberationnews.org

Trump goes all-in on racist voter disenfranchisement after...

After last night’s indecisive result, a massive effort is underway by the Trump campaign and Republican Party apparatus to prevent hundreds of thousands if not millions of votes from being counted. This effort has a clear racist character. #racism #votersuppressionAfter last night’s indecisive result, a massive effort is underway by the Trump campaign and Republican Party apparatus to prevent hundreds of thousands if not millions of votes from being counted. item.title: In a blatant act of voter intimidation in Georgia, a...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

In a blatant act of voter intimidation in Georgia, a representative from the Secretary of State showed up at a precinct in a predominantly African-American district. State House Representative Bee Nguyen reports that the rep, wearing a gun on his hip, forced poll workers to remove all food and water from the location.

From the LIVE Liberation News election coverage. Follow here: https://www.liberationnews.org/election-day-live-coverage/

Liberation News writers will be bringing you up-to-the-minute reporting on the election from a socialist perspective

liberationnews.org

Election Day live coverage

item.title: PSL presidential candidate Gloria La Riva told Liberation News...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

PSL presidential candidate Gloria La Riva told Liberation News after voting:

“Today is the culmination of thousands of hours of effort by our campaign volunteers and PSL members who worked tirelessly achieving ballot status for the La Riva/Freeman campaign in 15 states. This allowed our campaign to bring the message of socialism and expose the U.S. electoral system as a sham that only affirms capitalism’s right to exploit.”

check out this page for election day live updates: https://www.liberationnews.org/election-day-live-coverage/

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverBreakThrough News was live.When it comes to the 2020 US elections, everyone is talking about...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverBreakThrough News was live.

When it comes to the 2020 US elections, everyone is talking about chaos. Will it come to that? What if neither candidate refuses to recognize the results or one... declares victory before the votes are counted?

In whatever scenario, there is little doubt that a new era of struggle is coming. BreakThrough's hosts will be joined by Abby Martin, Jill Stein, Gloria La Riva, Jodi Dean and Jared Ball to discuss what happens next and what the results mean for the people's movements.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

Join PSL Presidential candidate Gloria La Riva share her reactions and analysis of the election on BreakThrough News in 1 hour. Also PSL organizer and author of the book "Comrade," Jodi Dean joins to share her perspective.

Show starts 9pm ET, 6pm PT.

#2020Election

item.title: Incredible work by the Dallas branch in the housing struggle....
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Incredible work by the Dallas branch in the housing struggle. Organizers successfully stopped an eviction and are building real tenant power!

"Apartment tenants in Dallas, working with the coalition Dallas Stops Evictions have served their landlords with a list of 24 demands to be met by mid-November. The tenants of Estelle Village apartments are calling for ceased evictions per the CDC moratorium, an end to restrictions on parking in the complex, and an end to harassment by private security, to name a few demands.

Just a few months before, DSE and the residents of Estara apartments in far east Dallas successfully stopped an eviction, provided tenants with paperwork and court support, and connected tenants to facilitate further organizing in their complex."

item.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
